primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus acts as the Way to lead humanity out of captivity, through earthly suffering, and into the Father's house.

tekstueel_bewijs: He declares us to have august connections.
The Shepherd will search and find his sheep.

object.identificatie: Reconciliation with the Father / Eternal Destiny
tekstueel_bewijs: a destiny so worthy and so wonderful
what else God has in store for us
We are children of a Father's house
it shall be for those: the wayfaring men
Remember how I have taught you
joining our paltry strength to his triumphant power
worship at the altar of greed
Death, dressed as a blonde woman
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but ontological captivity and the inevitability of Death (Samarkand).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's walk through life's tribulations following the path Jesus opened.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The believer's ability to walk (Secondary) is entirely dependent on Christ being the Way (Primary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Eternal Life → Humanity

voorbeelden_god_subject: Christ showed the unbelievable patience of God
He declares us to have august connections
The Shepherd will search and find his sheep
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We flail about in our own refined way
we are training our children to believe
A person so believing walks with a firmer tread

voorbeelden: how to deal with these things
joining our paltry strength to his triumphant power
make you able to avoid hard trials

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of Christ to overcome what humans cannot, rather than the 'Obligation' (Devoir) of the hearer.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Captivity (~S1) through the reality of Tribulation (~S2) to the triumph of Christ (S1) over Death (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies the space of S2 (Death) to bring the Receiver to S1 (Life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; Death is presented as an inescapable 'date'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains Jesus as the active Subject of salvation. Human effort is described as 'flailing' or 'paltry strength,' while Christ is the 'Way out, through, and in.'

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: What a harvest of disillusionment and collapse of the civic contract

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I will come again, and receive you unto myself
joining our paltry strength to his triumphant power

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The disciples are shown as failures/slow-witted, not models to imitate.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Thomas (as a foil for doubt/need for fact)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the teacher of the slow-witted, not the reward for the quick-witted.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance; the burden of 'finding the way' is shifted to the Shepherd.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones in the final act of being 'laid on his shoulders'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The three-fold structure (Way out, through, in) perfectly integrates the primary soteriological program.
spanning_punten: The transition from greed/politics to the eternal destiny is slightly abrupt but structurally sound.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'Pouvoir' directly to Christ's presence rather than a distinct pneumatology.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as 'captives and slaves' and 'dis-ease'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a robustly theocentric narrative where Christ is the sole Subject of the rescue operation.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain; this is appropriate for a grace-oriented sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Could slightly increase 'Savoir' regarding how the 'Way through' looks in daily ethics.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ as Way) correctly precedes and enables the secondary program (Walking through life).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in keeping God as the Subject. The use of the 'Samarkand' story reinforces the human inability to escape the Opponent (Death) without the Subject (Christ).

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'Samarkand' illustration's pathos, Greimasian analysis shows it functions to prove the hearer is the 'Receiver' of a fate they cannot control.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek 'hodos'; this analysis focuses on the functional role of 'The Way' as a Subject that moves the Object.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that even when the preacher discusses 'greed' (moral issue), the actantial Subject remains Christ who provides the 'Way out,' preventing the sermon from sliding into moralism.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper' trap where God is merely a tool for human success.
